  • Method Details

    • isPressed

      public boolean isPressed(Integer key)
      If the key is null, return false. Otherwise, return whether the key is being pressed.
      Parameters:
      key - The key you want to check if it's pressed.
      Returns:
      A boolean value.

    • isJustPressed

      public boolean isJustPressed(int key)
      If the key is being pressed, and it wasn't pressed last frame, then return true
      Parameters:
      key - The key you want to check.
      Returns:
      A boolean value.

    • isTouching

      public boolean isTouching(Spacial spacial)
      Is the pointer touching the spacial? The function isTouching() takes a Spacial as a parameter. It then returns a boolean value. The boolean value is true if the pointer is touching the spacial, and false if it is not.
      Parameters:
      spacial - The spacial you want to check if the pointer is touching.
      Returns:
      A boolean value.

    • getMouse

      public Vector2 getMouse()
      Get the mouse position and return it as a Vector2.
      Returns:
      The mouse position.

    • getPressing

      public Set<Integer> getPressing()
      Returns a set of integers representing the keys that are currently being pressed.
      Returns:
      A set of integers.

    • getAxis

      public float getAxis(String axisName)
      If the primary key is pressed, return -1. If the secondary key is pressed, return 1. If neither are pressed, return 0
      Parameters:
      axisName - The name of the axis you want to get the value of.
      Returns:
      A float value.

    • addAxis

      public void addAxis(String name, Integer primaryKey, Integer altPrimaryKey, Integer secondaryKey, Integer altSecondaryKey)
      Add an axis to the list of axes. The first parameter is the name of the axis. The next four parameters are the primary and secondary keys for the axis.
      Parameters:
      name - The name of the axis.
      primaryKey - The key that is used to move the axis in the negative direction.
      altPrimaryKey - The key that is used when the primary key is not pressed.
      secondaryKey - The key that is used to move the axis in the positive direction.
      altSecondaryKey - The key that is used when the secondary key is not pressed.

    • addAxis

      public void addAxis(String name, Integer primaryKey, Integer secondaryKey)
      Add an axis to the list of axes. The first parameter is the name of the axis. The next two parameters are the primary and secondary keys for the axis.
      Parameters:
      name - The name of the axis.
      primaryKey - The key that is used to move the axis in the negative direction.
      secondaryKey - The key that is used to move the axis in the positive direction.

    • getAxis

      public HashMap<String,YldPair<YldPair<Integer,Integer>,YldPair<Integer,Integer>>> getAxis()
      Getter for the axes list.

      public YldGame getGame()
      This function returns the game object.
      Returns:
      The game object.

      public Set<YldPair<Float,Float>> getPointers()
